transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker A: Hello?
Speaker B: Hello? Hi, am I speaking with Hyungi?
Speaker C: Oh yes.
Speaker B: Hi. How are you doing?
Speaker C: I just waiting for moving in London.
Speaker B: Perfect. But your accommodation. You were checking for some accommodation in our website, correct? And you have to IQ.
Speaker A: Your card.
Speaker B: Yeah. IQ Arcade.
Speaker D: But your payment is still pending so.
Speaker B: We are not able to proceed with the booking.
Speaker D: So could you please confirm?
Speaker B: Yeah.
Speaker C: Well, like two minutes ago I upload my mine 30 application document.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker C: Then you could check it and then if there are any other process that you need.
Speaker D: I can see you were. You were applying for IQ steering port.
Speaker A: I'm sorry?
Speaker D: You applied for IQ steering port, right?
Speaker A: IQ steering.
Speaker C: Oh yeah. Floor. Fourth floor.
Speaker D: IQ steering code.
Speaker A: Okay. Student court.
Speaker B: Yeah.
Speaker D: IQ steering code. Which accommodation you selected? You selected IQ Skip steering code.
Speaker B: Payment for saver ensuite, correct?
Speaker A: I don't think so.
Speaker D: Let me check WhatsApp on the number.
Speaker B: You have WhatsApp on the number, right?
Speaker C: Oh yes.
Speaker B: Yeah. Just hold on one second. Just open your WhatsApp. I'm sharing with the property and you can confirm me if you have applied for the same property.
Speaker C: Okay.
Speaker B: It. Yeah.
Speaker D: Have you opened your WhatsApp?
Speaker C: Yes.
Speaker B: Did you got my text? I said hello.
Speaker A: Oh, I'm so sorry.
Speaker C: Is it. What is your accommodation name?
Speaker B: Official partners with the university. My company name? Amber Student.
Speaker A: Amber Student? Oh, I just don't for to London. Oh, I'm sorry.
Speaker B: Pardon?
Speaker A: I'm so sorry.
Speaker C: Because I already booked another accommodation.
Speaker B: Okay. Can you tell me the name?
Speaker A: Tell me what? Tell you what?
Speaker B: Name the name of the accommodation so I can check.
Speaker A: Iq.
Speaker B: Are you not going to University College London?
Speaker C: Yes.
Speaker B: Then did you book from another's website?
Speaker C: Yes, unfortunately.
Speaker B: But that is not advisable from the university, right? You know another website can be scam or some other things, right?
Speaker C: Oh yes, of course.
Speaker B: That's why the university always recommend to book from us with official partners.
Speaker D: Yeah. Have you signed the agreement?
Speaker C: Oh yes, I already sign it and book it and I already pay it.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker D: You have already made the payment, right?
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker D: What was the name of the agency or the company where you made the payment?
Speaker A: Oh, I'm so sorry.
Speaker C: I cannot offer that name. So I have to do my workspace from right now.
Speaker A: So I'm sorry and thank you for calling.
Speaker D: No worries.
Speaker B: I was just looking out for you. So I can make sure you have not booked from any somewhere that is not authentic.
Speaker C: No, you don't have to. Okay, have a good day.
